title: GAO says NIH grant delays violated the Impoundment Control Act
summary: The Government Accountability Office (GAO) determined on August 5, 2025, that HHS and NIH illegally froze approximately 1,800 medical research grants in violation of the Impoundment Control Act. The Trump administration's delay of these congressionally appropriated funds for medical research constituted an unlawful withholding of funds that Congress had directed to be spent.
notes: This GAO finding represents one of many instances where the Trump administration illegally withheld congressionally appropriated funds. The freeze affected critical medical research during ongoing public health challenges.
